name: Marriott Plaza San Antonio

reviews.text: We booked this hotel through Priceline and was a bit disappointed that it wasn't directly on the Riverwalk. However, we were pleasantly surprised by the warmth of the lobby and the character of the hotel grounds. The rooms were larger than we are accustomed to and the courtyard was lush and well-maintained. The grounds had character with multiple older houses converted into reception halls, work-out facilities, etc. The beautiful birds roaming the courtyard added to the ambiance - not your standard cookie-cutter hotel. The hotel staff was always friendly and helpful. The proximity to the Rivercenter Mall, La Villita Market, and Hemisfair Park make the fact that you are not directly on the Riverwalk seem inconsequential. We truly didn't miss a thing. The rooms were VERY clean with up-to-date furnishings and very comfortable bedding.
reviews.title: Comfortable with character

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only negatives were: stuffy corridors (no a/c?), high-priced parking ($25/day or $19/day self.....this may be the norm for the area?) and really slow elevators.
reviews.title: Very nice stay

reviews.text: We will definitely return to Marriott Plaza!
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent two nights over Easter weekend at the Marriott Plaza. Paid $85/night plus tax with Priceline. Excellent staff, extremely friendly and helpful. Room and bath where both clean. Hotel restaurant is o.k. The staff there is attentive (Including the chef), but the food is nothing to write home about. Hotel is close to the Riverwalk and shopping. Taxi service is also easy to get.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel!

reviews.text: I "pricelined" this hotel for $96/night. We stayed for 3 nights over Easter weekend. The hotel staff was very friendly and accommodating. Our first room reeked of cigarette smoke, so I went back to the front desk and they gave me another room asap. They also upgraded us to a room with a view of the courtyard. My mom went with us and liked the hotel as well. Her room originally did not have a remote for the TV, but she let the front desk know and they sent one up. My room didn't have a bathrobe to begin with, but the front desk sent two up within minutes of my call. The kids loved the heated pool and hot tub. The workout facility was very nice. We ate breakfast at the hotel one morning and it was very good. They serve a buffet with a cook to order omelet, pancake and waffle station. The location of the hotel is excellent; just a five-minute stroll to the riverwalk. The self-serve parking was right next to the hotel ($16/day). The only issue I had was the internet access. The website states there is internet access in the guest rooms, but it doesn't tell you there's a $10/day charge for it. They have free wi-fi in the lobby, but it requires a user id an password from the front desk. This wasn't a huge issue, but it was a little inconvenient.
reviews.title: A relief in a city of disappointment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was a little disappointed at first when my wife "pricelined" this hotel because the pictures on the Marriott website look worse than in person. This hotel wasn't on the Riverwalk, but for this awesome price, we had to check it out. I must say, I've stayed at a lot of nice hotels, and for half of the regular rack rate, this place is a great deal. Our attendant checked us into a courtyard view room with a great view of the courtyard and free-roaming peacocks. The room was well furnished with nice bed linens. The room had updated carpet and furniture. The bathroom was average Marriott quality, but overall the room was clean. I must comment that the 20" TV was a little too small. I was expecting a 27" or 32" from a Marriott. The breakfast buffet was average for $13. We self parked instead of valet, because the lot was literally in front of the hotel without the hassle of having to wait for the valet attendant. There was plenty of close spots during our weekday stay. Walking to the Riverwalk was about 2 blocks away, but well-lit and very public. Overall, this hotel is an excellent alternative to an on the Riverwalk hotel.
reviews.title: Better than we expected!

reviews.text: From the pictures on the website I really thought this hotel was the top of the line. However it really is not, I assumed since it is a Marriott, it mirrors the one off the San Antonio Rivercenter mall. We orginally requested adjoining rooms and did not get adjoinng room, we also asked for double beds and ended up with only one room which had double beds. Maybe it was because of the holiday but I did not see the staff being over friendly or customer oriented at all. I would not recommend this hotel as a four or five start hotel, this is a little higher than Laquinta across the Market Square.
reviews.title: New Year's at the San Antonio Marriott Plaza

likes.disliked: — The hotel needs remolding, dirty elevators and floors

reviews.text: I booked this hotel through Priceline at a rate of $75/night (Sat. - Tuesday). Hoping that I would get a hotel on the Riverwalk through Priceline, I was initially hesitant that it wasn't directly on the Riverwalk. It didn't matter though! Just a few minutes to walk to the Riverwalk, and the personnel at the Marriott Plaza made sure we enjoyed every minute of our stay...even for a cheap Priceline customer.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Plaza San Antonio for my hometown’s downtown New Years celebration--which is held steps away from the hotel’s entrance. Although I’ve been using this hotel for the last four years for this event this is my first review. It never seems that the hotel can get this special event right. After completing the arrival, parking and check-in process the attitude I came away with was that the hotel wasn’t expecting a full house that was all going to check in at the same time. The staff always seems amazed that everyone shows up. This year it was parking—my greeting to the 4-star Marriott property was a bellman yelling,”Keep that car straight, you need to move it, I can’t get any cars through!” My car was the third in line at the front drive directly behind the second car with at least 12 feet of clearance between my side of the car and the other side of the entrance drive. This bellman needed to settle down. When I said I wanted to self-park the car the parking staff said it was only valet for this day. Although this change in procedure was not advised in any of my communication with the hotel the staff still just charged the self-park rate. This was this year’s example of the hotel just not being ready for this event. They know it’s going to happen and they complete planning to the 90% level, but they never seem to be able to reach 100%. I will use this hotel again next year for this event because of the location, but they do need to think it through.
reviews.title: Not ready for New Years'

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Not what I expected. Not a place to stay if wanting a romantic getaway (unless you just found them on the local corner). Rooms are on an upscale Motel 8. Not what you paid for. Breakfast Room Service would of been better if handed a bag from the local McDonalds. You think for the price that parking would be included plus valet. Kids or teenagers loud down the hallway. Guess their parents were on another floor.
reviews.title: Romantic Couples Beware

reviews.text: The staff were/are very helpful and friendly. The hotel should reflect this. Also noticed when checking out that the maid-carts did not have clean glasses on them plus few towels and bed linens. I know I didn't see anyone running back and forth carrying clean ones.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel

reviews.text: Next night stayed at the Hill Country Hyatt Resort and Spa....hope you enjoy the Country Club lifestyle !!!
reviews.title: What an unexpected gem - very relaxing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for a conference we were attending. The hotel is not on the river but a very close walk to it. Very clean rooms with the most comfortable beds and pillows. The bathroom had wonderful counter space and tons of towels. I see this as more of a hotel for conferences or business travelers. If I were here for pleasure I would want to be on the river.
reviews.title: Great beds, noisey at night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I did a 2 day get away to this hotel right in the heart of the Riverwalk area. It was a very nice facility overall. Pool area was really nice with plush surroundings and peacocks walking around the courtyard. I was bothered when told it would cost an additional $16 to stay in their parking area. At the end of our stay it never showed up as a charge so I don't know what happened. It could have been for valet parking which we did not use. Service during the evening hours wasn't the best. Just trying to get desert and a coffee at about 9:30 pm took some time, but it finally came. I would highly reccommend the chocolate cake with the raspberry sauce dripped over it. Breakfast was also nice, but about $23 for two of us. The Blueberry Pancakes were enough for two people and they were excellent as well. Overall not a bad deal at $132 per night.
reviews.title: Very close to Riverwalk.

likes.liked: — Location relevant to destination of RIver Walk
likes.disliked: — Possibility of hotel charging $16 per day for parking.

reviews.title: Luxurious Bedding, Nice Green Courtyard
reviews.text: Stayed 3 nights at this older, yet clean and comfortable hotel. There is onsite self-parking for a daily fee, which I did not mind, and the in-room movies are great for a lower-key evening after dinner or an outting on the Riverwalk. The recent Marriott bedding upgrade has won me over, since the down comforters & pillows, the cotton sheets, and the luxurious mattress make my stay comfortable and help ensure that I will sleep well. My room was at the back of the hotel, near the green courtyard. Very quiet. The pool area is nice, too. I had no problem with noise from either the guests, staff or exotic birds. And no bad smells, as some have posted. Room service meals (breakfast) are expensive, but that seems to be the norm at most Marriotts. While the Marriott Plaza San Antonio is not on the riverwalk -- it's just a few blocks away -- I would stay here again.
Our 11 year old daughter had a 2 day golf tournament so we decided to make a weekend of it, rather than drive back & forth from Austin.
reviews.title: What a restful stay!

likes.disliked: — Mattress was indented although not terribly, just not up to Marriott standards

reviews.text: We were greeted by the most cheerful & personable valet. Throughout our stay, whenever we returned from the golf course he always inquired as to how she did for the day and always had a positive comment for her. You could tell he really cared about the guests.
reviews.title: A Fantastic Stay!
